title: angelovangel/nxf-alignment
description: Basecall, align, and analyze ONT data

basecalling_options.title: Basecalling/Input reads options
basecalling_options.description: Choose pod5 folder or reads (skips basecalling), if pod5 choose model and adaptive sampling decisions file (optional).

pod5.description: Directory with POD5 files (use when basecalling)
pod5.help_text: Path to directory containing POD5 files for basecalling. If this is selected then basecalling will be performed (do not select reads).

model.help_text: Name of the Dorado model to use for basecalling. Default is 'fast'. For modifications, use for example 'hac,5mCG_5hmCG'. See how to use [Dorado models here](https://software-docs.nanoporetech.com/dorado/latest/models/selection/).

herro.help_text: Set to true to enable HERRO read correction. The corrected reads will be in 00-basecall, but will NOT be used in alignment.

reads.description: BAM/FASTQ file or directory of reads (skips basecalling)
reads.help_text: Path to a single BAM/FASTQ file or directory containing multiple read files (each file is a sample). If this is selected then basecalling will be skipped (do not select pod5).

asfile.help_text: CSV file from adaptive sampling that filters which reads to basecall (use when adaptive sampling run). This file is generated by MinKNOW during an adaptive sampling run, and can be found under `runfolder/adaptive_sampling/AS_decisions.csv`

barcoding_options.title: Barcoding options
barcoding_options.description: Select these only if run is barcoded.

kit.help_text: Name of the barcoding kit used. Required when run is barcoded.

samplesheet.description: CSV file with sample and barcode information
samplesheet.help_text: Samplesheet CSV file must contain at least columns 'sample' and 'barcode'. Required when run is barcoded.

ref.help_text: Path to reference FASTA file for alignment. Required unless using -entry basecall.

bed.description: BED file with regions of interest
bed.help_text: BED file defining regions of interest with 4 columns (chrom, start, end, name). If omitted, will be auto-generated from the reference file.

variant_calling_options.title: Variant calling options
variant_calling_options.description: Options for variant calling using Clair3 or DeepVariant.

variants.description: Enable variant calling with Clair3 or DeepVariant
variants.help_text: Set to true to enable variant calling on the aligned reads using Clair3 or DeepVariant.

variant_caller.help_text: Variant caller to use. Clair3 is recommended for ONT data.

clair3_platform.help_text: The platform for which the Clair3 model was trained. Only used when --variants is specified.

clair3_model.help_text: The specific Clair3 model name. Only used when --variants is specified. See available models in the Clair3 documentation.

annotate.help_text: Set to true to enable variant annotation on the variant calls using snpEff. Only used when --variants is specified.

anno_db.help_text: The snpEff database to use. Use the same database version as the reference genome used in alignment. Check snpEff documentation for available databases (we do not support custom databases).

anno_filterQ.help_text: Filter out variants with quality score lower than this before annotation.

outdir.description: The name of the output directory where the results will be saved
outdir.help_text: It is recommended to not change the default output directory
